original:
Introduction (100 words)
The National Incident Management System (NIMS) serves as a crucial framework for effectively managing and coordinating responses to incidents in the United States. Since its establishment in 2003, NIMS has played a pivotal role in strengthening homeland security by promoting a unified approach and ensuring efficient collaboration across various jurisdictions and agencies.

The National Incident Management System (NIMS) serves as a crucial framework for effectively managing and coordinating responses to incidents in the United States.
